bibl.title: Letter from J.F. Siler to Philip Showalter Hench, November 4, 1950

div1.p: Siler inquires if Hench might be able to attend a meeting of the Reed Memorial Association on his return home from Europe after receiving the Nobel Prize.

div1.head: Letter from J.F. Siler to Philip Showalter Hench, November 4, 1950
div1.opener:
GORGAS MEMORIAL INSTITUTE
OF
TROPICAL AND PREVENTIVE MEDICINE
INCORPORATED
----
GORGAS MEMORIAL LABORATORY
EXECUTIVE OFFICES
1835 EYE STREET, NORTHWEST
WASHINGTON 6, D. C.
November 4, 1950
JOSEPH F. SILER
PRESIDENT
MAURICE H. THATCHER
VICE PRESIDENT AND GENERAL COUNSEL
WALTER A. BLOEDORN
SECRETARY
Dr. Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minn
My dear Doctor Hench:
div1.p:
I had been hoping to hear from you advising us of the time of your
return to the States and had been hoping that you could come by Washington on
your way back to Rochester in which case we could have our annual meeting.

A few days ago I noted with very great pleasure that you have been
awarded the Nobel prize and will receive it early in December. I presume that
it would be your intention to go back to Europe to receive the prize and I
am wondering if it might no be possible for you to stop off in Washington on
your return enroute from Europe to Rochester to attend the annual meeting of
the Walter Reed Memorial Association.

As you know it will be necessary for us to elect a new President this
year and replacements for two or three members of the Board. If it is possible
for you to meet with us some time in December, we will greatly appreciate it.
If you will advise me to that effect, we will be able to set any date suggested
by you and send notices to the other members of the Board.

closer.signed:
J. F. Siler
Col., (MC), U.S.A., Ret'd
Secretary, Walter Reed
Memorial Association
